definition: endgame (in chess)/desperate situation/aftermath (of a failure)
to destroy/to spoil/to ruin/to injure/cruel/oppressive/savage/brutal/incomplete/disabled/to remain/to survive/remnant/surplus
narrow
office/situation/classifier for games: match, set, round etc
to clear up the mess/to pick up the pieces

sentences.english: Before the endgame, the gods have placed the middlegame. - Tarrasch.
sentences.chinese: 残局以前，上帝已寄予了中局。

sentences.english: He was also there to pick up the pieces when his rivals tripped up.
sentences.chinese: 当他的对手遇到问题时他总是可以收拾残局。

sentences.english: Instead, the overriding consideration should be to minimize the cost of the cleanup.
sentences.chinese: 相反，最应当考虑的是尽量减少收拾残局的费用。

sentences.english: Finally tidies up this piece of aftermath the person, only can be you.
sentences.chinese: 最后收拾这片残局的人，只能是你自己。

sentences.english: Shirov is both a representative of romantic chess and an endgame virtuoso.
sentences.chinese: 希罗夫既是浪漫派的代表又是一个精于残局的大师。

sentences.english: In all of these endgame databases it is assumed that castling is no longer possible.
sentences.chinese: 在这些残局库中，都假定王车易位不再可能出现。

sentences.english: And now, let's look at the first half of chapter four of my book Endgame.
sentences.chinese: 现在，让我们看看书残局上半年我的第四章。

sentences.english: How does black get an endgame with a piece up.
sentences.chinese: 黑方如何获得一个多一子的残局？

definition: state of play in a game of chess/(old) chessboard
chess/chess-like game/a game of chess/CL:盤|盘[pan2]/chess piece/CL:個|个[ge4],顆|颗[ke1]
variant of 棋[qi2]
variant of 棋[qi2]

draw or tie in chess etc/CL:盤|盘[pan2]

chessboard
dead piece (in Chess)/stupid move/hopeless case
hopeless situation/deadlock
gambling get-together/game of cards, mahjong etc
to respond to an assault by killing one's assailant
endgame/conclusion/outcome/final part of a chess game
land battle chess, Chinese board game similar to Stratego
firefight/shooting
endgame (in go)
to turn defeat into victory (idiom); to turn the tide
